1.text: With freedom did Christ set us free: stand fast therefore, and be not entangled again in a yoke of bondage.

2.text: Behold, I Paul say unto you, that, if ye receive circumcision, Christ will profit you nothing.

3.text: Yea, I testify again to every man that receiveth circumcision, that he is a debtor to do the whole law.

4.text: Ye are severed from Christ, ye who would be justified by the law; ye are fallen away from grace.

5.text: For we through the Spirit by faith wait for the hope of righteousness.

6.text: For in Christ Jesus neither circumcision availeth anything, nor uncircumcision; but faith working through love.

7.text: Ye were running well; who did hinder you that ye should not obey the truth?

8.text: This persuasion came not of him that calleth you.

9.text: A little leaven leaveneth the whole lump.

10.text: I have confidence to you-ward in the Lord, that ye will be none otherwise minded: but he that troubleth you shall bear his judgment, whosoever he be.

11.text: But I, brethren, if I still preach circumcision, why am I still persecuted? then hath the stumblingblock of the cross been done away.

12.text: I would that they which unsettle you would even cut themselves off.

13.text: For ye, brethren, were called for freedom; only use not your freedom for an occasion to the flesh, but through love be servants one to another.

14.text: For the whole law is fulfilled in one word, even in this; Thou shalt love thy neighbour as thyself.

15.text: But if ye bite and devour one another, take heed that ye be not consumed one of another.

16.text: But I say, Walk by the Spirit, and ye shall not fulfill the lust of the flesh.

17.text: For the flesh lusteth against the Spirit, and the Spirit against the flesh; for these are contrary the one to the other; that ye may not do the things that ye would.

18.text: But if ye are led by the Spirit, ye are not under the law.

19.text: Now the works of the flesh are manifest, which are these, fornication, uncleanness, lasciviousness,

20.text: idolatry, sorcery, enmities, strife, jealousies, wraths, factions, divisions, heresies,

21.text: envyings, drunkenness, revellings, and such like: of the which I forewarn you, even as I did forewarn you, that they which practise such things shall not inherit the kingdom of God.

22.text: But the fruit of the Spirit is love, joy, peace, longsuffering, kindness, goodness, faithfulness,

23.text: meekness, temperance: against such there is no law.

24.text: And they that are of Christ Jesus have crucified the flesh with the passions and the lusts thereof.

25.text: If we live by the Spirit, by the Spirit let us also walk.

26.text: Let us not be vainglorious, provoking one another, envying one another.
